abstract: Now used by more big technology companies, open-source software has become a weapon in corporate warfare.
snippet: Now used by more big technology companies, open-source software has become a weapon in corporate warfare.
lead_paragraph: Free open-source software began with high-technology tinkerers and researchers. Sharing code and ideas was their priority, not profits. In the tech industry, they were sometimes compared to socialists and communists.

headline.main: Software War Pits Oracle vs. Google
headline.print_headline: Software War Pits Oracle Vs. Google

abstract: Mostly the young are interested in letting others know their physical location. Others are reticent for safety reasons, or against providing too much information.
snippet: Mostly the young are interested in letting others know their physical location. Others are reticent for safety reasons, or against providing too much information.
lead_paragraph: Internet companies have appropriated the real estate business’s mantra  it’s all about location, location, location.

headline.main: Technology Aside, Most People Still Decline to Be Located
headline.print_headline: Technology Aside, Most People Still Decline to Be Located

byline.original: By Claire Cain Miller and Jenna Wortham

abstract: Google has acquired Angstro, a startup that sorts news and information across social networks like Facebook, a spokesman for the leading Web search provider said on Sunday, Reuters reported.
snippet: Google has acquired Angstro, a startup that sorts news and information across social networks like Facebook, a spokesman for the leading Web search provider said on Sunday, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Google has acquired Angstro, a start-up that sorts news and information across social networks like Facebook, a spokesman for the leading Web search provider said on Sunday, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Google Acquires Angstro, a Social Networking Aid

abstract: Cisco has reportedly made an offer to acquire internet phone firm Skype before it completes its planned initial public offering, VentureBeat said, citing a rumor reported by Techcrunch.
snippet: Cisco has reportedly made an offer to acquire internet phone firm Skype before it completes its planned initial public offering, VentureBeat said, citing a rumor reported by Techcrunch.
lead_paragraph: Cisco has reportedly made an offer to acquire the Internet phone firm Skype before it completes its planned initial public offering, TechCrunch said.

headline.main: Cisco Rumored to Make Offer for Skype

abstract: Google has now announced acquisitions of 25 companies in the 12 months since its chief executive, Eric Schmidt, said he expected to do a deal at least once a month.
snippet: Google has now announced acquisitions of 25 companies in the 12 months since its chief executive, Eric Schmidt, said he expected to do a deal at least once a month.
lead_paragraph: 3:37 p.m. | Updated  Google has made another acquisition today, buying SocialDeck of Canada for an undisclosed price.

abstract: Google moves from algorithms to video shows with the Google Beat, which is based on each week’s trending topics in search results.
snippet: Google moves from algorithms to video shows with the Google Beat, which is based on each week’s trending topics in search results.
lead_paragraph: Although Google likes to think of itself as an army of programmers, the company continues to create more content on a daily basis — and those of us who use its products seem to unknowingly help.

headline.main: A Video Show From Google Highlights Hot Topics

abstract: A new application brings Bing services to Verizon Wireless phones running the Android operating system from Google.
snippet: A new application brings Bing services to Verizon Wireless phones running the Android operating system from Google.
lead_paragraph: In late 2009, when Microsoft introduced a downloadable application for the iPhone from Apple, it set off some excitement in the tech world. For years, Microsoft and Apple had been head-to-head in the war for personal computing.
